intro: Lignieria alpestris, commonly known as the alpine lignieria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. It produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Lignieria alpestris is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
